item.title: Click Here To Listen!
item.description:
Click Here To Listen!

TROP N' ROLL with SOUL from NEW ORLEANS

item.title: PRESSWhat are people saying about Marina Orchestra?“Whether it is their contagious beats, their sweet harmonies, or their feel good tunes, WUTK listeners love Marina Orchestra! The music sounds great on the radio, but it’s their live shows where the real magic happens. Another fantastic band that helps to make the Knoxville local music scene so very strong…and fun!” -Benny Smith WUTK Radio“In a business in which the greatest accolades often go to the most shameless poseurs, Marina Orchestra takes the opposite approach by combining a sincere love of their influences with a genuine desire to make people dance.” -Fred of The Rockwells“…tropically tinged dance-rock heavy on world music influences and a perfect cure for winter blahs and life blues…”-The Daily Times“…infectious, highly danceable indie-pop take on African, Caribbean, and Latin American musical styles…”-Metro Pulse“…an array of genre-blurring sounds, but the sounds are secondary to the spirit. Marina Orchestra is a fun band that has an energy that makes you want to dance. ”-Knoxville Music Warehouse“…a combination of indie rock and Caribbean intoxication; a concoction that was impossible to stand still to.”-Knoxville Music Warehouse“…a ragged but enthusiastic—and funky—kind of worldbeat rock that absorbs inspiration from all over the world but doesn’t limit itself to strict imitation.” -Matthew Everett Metro Pulse“Think of if Vampire Weekend spent three years writing music in The Caribbean.”-Knoxville Music Warehouse
item.description:
PRESSWhat are people saying about Marina Orchestra?“Whether it is their contagious beats, their sweet harmonies, or their feel good tunes, WUTK listeners love Marina Orchestra!  The music sounds great on the radio, but it’s their live shows where the real magic happens.  Another fantastic band that helps to make the Knoxville local music scene so very strong…and fun!” -Benny Smith WUTK Radio“In a business in which the greatest accolades often go to the most shameless poseurs, Marina Orchestra takes the opposite approach by combining a sincere love of their influences with a genuine desire to make people dance.” -Fred of The Rockwells“…tropically tinged dance-rock heavy on world music influences and a perfect cure for winter blahs and life blues…”-The Daily Times“…infectious, highly danceable indie-pop take on African, Caribbean, and Latin American musical styles…”-Metro Pulse“…an array of genre-blurring sounds, but the sounds are secondary to the spirit. Marina Orchestra is a fun band that has an energy that makes you want to dance. ”-Knoxville Music Warehouse“…a combination of indie rock and Caribbean intoxication; a concoction that was impossible to stand still to.”-Knoxville Music Warehouse“…a ragged but enthusiastic—and funky—kind of worldbeat rock that absorbs inspiration from all over the world but doesn’t limit itself to strict imitation.” -Matthew Everett Metro Pulse“Think of if Vampire Weekend spent three years writing music in The Caribbean.”-Knoxville Music Warehouse

Press

item.title: Live!
item.description:
Live!

Marina Orchestra will be at Banks St. Bar (4401 Banks St.) on December 12, 2015 with Doombalaya! This free show starts at 10pm!

item.title: BIO
item.description:
BIO

Marina Orchestra isn’t just another Rock N’ Roll band, it’s a seven-piece Trop n’ Roll extravaganza complete with back up singers, horn lines and poly-rhythms galore. They’ve been shaking up audiences with their euphoric brand of Rock n’ Roll which is steeped in African, Latin American and Caribbean musical styles. Driven by a desire to see ‘listening rooms’ transformed into ‘dancing rooms’- The title of their sophomore album “Oceans” refers to the oceans of Marina Orchestra fans bobbing to their energetic live performances. “Everybody moves like the waves,” sings frontman Justin Powers “Ringing in another day”.
